alert.note: Alert for Eastern Franklin; Eastern Hampden; Eastern Hampshire; Northern Worcester; Western Franklin; Western Hampden; Western Hampshire (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 1:25PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 40 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 124 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from Cheshire to near Great Barrington to near Staatsburg and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Worthington, Cummington, Plainfield, Middlefield, and Hawley around 135 PM EST. Ashfield around 140 PM EST. Buckland, Chester, Charlemont, Chesterfield, and Goshen around 145 PM EST. Blandford and Tolland around 150 PM EST. Williamsburg, Huntington, Conway, and Shelburne around 155 PM EST. Greenfield, Deerfield, Russell, Westhampton, Granville, and Montgomery around 200 PM EST. Northampton, Montague, Southampton, and Whately around 205 PM EST. Westfield, Easthampton, Sunderland, Hatfield, Hartland, and Gill around 210 PM EST. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
